may resign the assignment by informing the Scottish Ministers in writing to that effect,
is assigned it, and ceases to be assigned it, in accordance with such terms and conditions as the Scottish Ministers determine.

P2para.Text: The Scottish Ministers may, subject to any provision made by this Act, determine other terms and conditions of membership.
A person’s appointment as a member of Qualifications Scotland ends if—

P3para.Text: the person resigns by giving written notice to the Scottish Ministers,
during the person’s period of appointment, the person becomes ineligible to be appointed as a member under paragraph 3(7), or
the Scottish Ministers give the person written notice that the person is removed from Qualifications Scotland.

P2para.Text: The Scottish Ministers may remove a member of Qualifications Scotland by virtue of sub-paragraph (1)(c) only if—

P3para.Text: the member is apparently insolvent (within the meaning of section 16 of the Bankruptcy (Scotland) Act 2016),
the member has been absent, without reasonable excuse, from meetings of Qualifications Scotland for a period of longer than 6 consecutive months,
the member—

P4para.Text: was appointed to satisfy paragraph 3(2)(b)(i) or (ii), and
has ceased to be a person mentioned in that paragraph, or

P3para.Text: the Scottish Ministers consider that the member is—

P4para.Text: unable to perform the functions of a member, or
unsuitable to continue as a member.

P1para.Text: Qualifications Scotland may pay each member such remuneration and allowances (including expenses), if any, as the Scottish Ministers determine.

P2para.Text: Qualifications Scotland may appoint a person as a co-opted member of Qualifications Scotland.
Qualifications Scotland may make an appointment under sub-paragraph (1) only—

P3para.Text: with the consent of the Scottish Ministers, and
if Qualifications Scotland considers the appointment to be necessary to ensure that its members (taken as a whole) have the knowledge, skills and experience relevant to its functions.

P2para.Text: Qualifications Scotland may have no more than two co-opted members at any time.
A co-opted member—

P3para.Text: may take part in proceedings of Qualifications Scotland to the extent that Qualifications Scotland determines, but
may not vote in any such proceedings.

P2para.Text: A co-opted member—

P3para.Text: is appointed for such period not exceeding 2 years as Qualifications Scotland determines,
may be reappointed on one or more occasions, provided that the total period of reappointment does not exceed 2 years.

P2para.Text: Sub-paragraph (2) applies to a re-appointment made under sub-paragraph (5)(b) as it applies to an appointment made under sub-paragraph (1).
A person may not be appointed (or re-appointed) as a co-opted member if the person may not be appointed as a member under paragraph 3(7).
A person’s appointment as a co-opted member ends if—

P3para.Text: the person resigns by giving written notice to Qualifications Scotland,
during the person’s period of appointment, the person becomes ineligible to be appointed as a co-opted member under sub-paragraph (7), or
Qualifications Scotland or the Scottish Ministers give the person written notice that the person is removed from Qualifications Scotland.

P2para.Text: Qualifications Scotland or the Scottish Ministers may remove a co-opted member by virtue of sub-paragraph (8)(c) only if—

P3para.Text: the co-opted member is apparently insolvent (within the meaning of section 16 of the Bankruptcy (Scotland) Act 2016),
the co-opted member has been absent, without reasonable excuse, from meetings of Qualifications Scotland for a period of longer than 6 consecutive months, or
Qualifications Scotland considers or, as the case may be, the Scottish Ministers consider that the co-opted member is—

P4para.Text: unable to perform the functions of a co-opted member, or
unsuitable to continue as a co-opted member.

P2para.Text: Other than as provided in this paragraph, a co-opted member of Qualifications Scotland is appointed on such terms and conditions (including as to remuneration and allowances) as Qualifications Scotland, with the consent of the Scottish Ministers, determines.
A reference in paragraphs 3 to 6 to a member or the members of Qualifications Scotland does not include a reference to a co-opted member.

P1group.Title: Chief executive, chief examiner, chief accreditation officer and other staff

P2para.Text: Qualifications Scotland is to have as members of staff—

P3para.Text: a chief executive,
a chief examiner,
a chief accreditation officer.

P2para.Text: The chief examiner is to be appointed by Qualifications Scotland to undertake such role relating to Qualification Scotland’s functions under sections 2 and 3 as Qualifications Scotland determines, but that role must include responding to written advice provided to Qualifications Scotland by the Expert Group on Qualifications Standards under section 10.
The chief accreditation officer—

P3para.Text: is to be appointed by Qualifications Scotland to undertake such role relating to Qualifications Scotland’s functions under section 4 as the Accreditation Committee determines,

must, in the exercise of any functions relating to that role, act independently of the chief examiner (but this does not prevent the chief accreditation officer and the chief examiner from sharing information with each other).

P2para.Text: An individual may not simultaneously hold more than one role mentioned in sub-paragraph (1).
Qualifications Scotland is to appoint each chief executive with the approval of the Scottish Ministers.

Qualifications Scotland may appoint an individual as the chief examiner only where it considers that the individual has suitable experience of working in the education, training, qualifications or skills development sector.
Qualifications Scotland may appoint other staff.

The chief executive, chief examiner, chief accreditation officer and other staff are appointed on such terms and conditions as Qualifications Scotland, with the approval of the Scottish Ministers, determines.

Qualifications Scotland may, with the approval of the Scottish Ministers, pay or make arrangements for the payment of pensions, allowances and gratuities to, or in respect of, any person who is or has been a member of staff of Qualifications Scotland.
Those arrangements may include—

P3para.Text: making payments towards the provision of those pensions, allowances and gratuities,
providing and maintaining schemes for the payment of those pensions, allowances and gratuities.

P2para.Text: The reference in sub-paragraph (1) to pensions, allowances and gratuities includes pensions, allowances and gratuities by way of compensation for loss of office.
In addition to those established in accordance with paragraphs 11 to 13, Qualifications Scotland—

P3para.Text: may establish such further committees as it sees fit,
may establish such sub-committees as it sees fit, other than in relation to the Accreditation Committee where the committee itself may establish such sub-committees as it sees fit.

P2para.Text: The membership of a committee or sub-committee may include persons who are not members of Qualifications Scotland.

Qualifications Scotland may pay such remuneration and allowances (including expenses) as the Scottish Ministers determine to each member of a committee or sub-committee who is not a member of, or member of staff of, Qualifications Scotland.
Subject to paragraph 13(3)(a), a committee or sub-committee must comply with any directions given to it by Qualifications Scotland.

If Qualifications Scotland establishes a committee under sub-paragraph (1) with functions which primarily concern the governance of the staff of Qualifications Scotland, the convener of the committee must be a member appointed to satisfy paragraph 3(2)(c).
Qualifications Scotland must establish and maintain a committee to be known as the Learner Interest Committee.

The function of the committee is to advise the members and staff of Qualifications Scotland in relation to the exercise of Qualifications Scotland’s functions from the perspective of persons undertaking a Qualifications Scotland qualification.
The committee—

P3para.Text: may include one member of Qualifications Scotland who was appointed to satisfy paragraph 3(2)(a),
other than any appointment made under paragraph (a), must consist of—

P4para.Text: children and young people (whether or not they have experience in relation to undertaking a Qualifications Scotland qualification), and
other persons who are undertaking, or have recent experience of undertaking, a Qualifications Scotland qualification.

P2para.Text: The committee members appointed by virtue of sub-paragraph (3)(b) must not include persons who are members of, or members of staff of, Qualifications Scotland.

In the event that a committee member is appointed by virtue of sub-paragraph (3)(a), Qualifications Scotland must appoint that committee member and another committee member as co-conveners of the committee.
A committee member appointed by virtue of sub-paragraph (3)(a) is not entitled to vote at any meeting of the committee.
In appointing persons to the committee, Qualifications Scotland must—

P3para.Text: encourage equal opportunities and in particular the observance of the equal opportunity requirements,
have regard to the desirability of the committee including persons who—

P4para.Text: have experience of being in the care system,
are from a socio-economically disadvantaged background, or
have educational support needs.

P2para.Text: Before appointing a person as a member of the committee, Qualifications Scotland must consult the Scottish Ministers.
In the exercise of its functions, the committee must, in every case in which it appears to the committee appropriate to do so, consult—

P3para.Text: the Strategic Advisory Council,
the Teacher and Practitioner Interest Committee,
any other committee or sub-committee established by Qualifications Scotland,
such other persons as the committee considers appropriate.

P2para.Text: Qualifications Scotland must convene a meeting of members of Qualifications Scotland and of the committee where—

P3para.Text: the committee reasonably requests a meeting, or
Qualifications Scotland otherwise considers it appropriate to do so.

P2para.Text: For the purposes of sub-paragraph (3)(b)(i), “children and young people” means persons under the age of 18.

P1group.Title: The Teacher and Practitioner Interest Committee

P2para.Text: Qualifications Scotland must establish and maintain a committee to be known as the Teacher and Practitioner Interest Committee.

The function of the committee is to advise the members and staff of Qualifications Scotland in relation to the exercise of Qualifications Scotland’s functions from the perspective of persons providing teaching or training in respect of a Qualifications Scotland qualification.
The committee—

P3para.Text: may include one member of Qualifications Scotland who was appointed to satisfy paragraph 3(2)(b),
other than any appointment made under paragraph (a), must consist of—

P4para.Text: one or more persons who are undertaking, or who have recent experience of undertaking, training to be teachers in schools, and
persons who are providing teaching or training, or have recent experience of providing teaching or training, in respect of a Qualifications Scotland qualification.

P2para.Text: The committee members appointed by virtue of sub-paragraph (3)(b) must not include persons who are members of, or members of staff of, Qualifications Scotland.

In the event that a committee member is appointed by virtue of sub-paragraph (3)(a), Qualifications Scotland must appoint that committee member and another committee member as co-conveners of the committee.
A committee member appointed by virtue of sub-paragraph (3)(a) is not entitled to vote at any meeting of the committee.
In appointing persons to the committee, Qualifications Scotland must encourage equal opportunities and in particular the observance of the equal opportunity requirements.
Before appointing a person as a member of the committee, Qualifications Scotland must consult the Scottish Ministers.
In the exercise of its functions, the committee must, in every case in which it appears to the committee appropriate to do so, consult—

P3para.Text: the Strategic Advisory Council,
the Learner Interest Committee,
any other committee or sub-committee established by Qualifications Scotland,
representatives from recognised trade unions which represent the interests of the persons mentioned in sub-paragraph (3)(b),
such other persons as the committee considers appropriate.

P2para.Text: Qualifications Scotland must convene a meeting of members of Qualifications Scotland and of the committee where—

P3para.Text: the committee reasonably requests a meeting, or
Qualifications Scotland otherwise considers it appropriate to do so.

P2para.Text: Qualifications Scotland must establish and maintain a committee to be known as the Accreditation Committee.
The functions of the committee are to—

P3para.Text: carry out the function conferred by section 4(1),
advise the Scottish Ministers on any matters relating to that function.

P2para.Text: In carrying out its functions, the committee (and any sub-committee of it)—

P3para.Text: is not subject to the direction or control of Qualifications Scotland, and
must act independently of Qualifications Scotland (but this does not prevent the committee or any sub-committee of it and Qualifications Scotland from sharing information with each other).

P2para.Text: The committee is to consist of—

P3para.Text: the convener appointed under paragraph 2(1)(b), and
individuals appointed by the convener as committee members, a majority of whom must not be members of Qualifications Scotland.

P2para.Text: Members of staff of Qualifications Scotland may not be appointed as members of the committee but they must be allowed to observe or participate in meetings of the committee at the discretion of the convener.
The Scottish Ministers may assign to a person appointed as a member of Qualifications Scotland—

P3para.Text: the function of deputising for the convener,
the function of convening the committee during any period when there is no convener.

P2para.Text: A member to whom such a function is assigned—

P3para.Text: is assigned the function for such period as the Scottish Ministers specify in the assignment,
may resign the assignment by informing the Scottish Ministers in writing to that effect,
is assigned it, and ceases to be assigned it, in accordance with such terms and conditions as the Scottish Ministers determine,
is, when exercising the function, to be treated as being a member of the committee (if not otherwise such a member).

Chapter.Title: Administration of Qualifications Scotland and its committees

P2para.Text: In each financial year, at least one meeting of Qualifications Scotland is to be open to the public.

But during consideration of any matter which Qualifications Scotland is satisfied should be dealt with on a confidential basis, those entitled to attend as members of the public may be temporarily excluded.
Qualifications Scotland must take reasonable steps to promote attendance at its public meetings by members of the public.
The power to give directions with which compliance is required under paragraph 10(4) includes the power for Qualifications Scotland to direct its committees or sub-committees—

P3para.Text: to open at least one of their meetings each financial year to the public, and
to take reasonable steps to promote attendance at their respective public meetings by such persons as Qualifications Scotland considers appropriate.

P2para.Text: At any meeting of the Accreditation Committee, a quorum is established only if the majority of members present at the meeting are not members, or members of staff, of Qualifications Scotland.

The Scottish Ministers may by regulations make such further provision as they see fit in relation to the procedure (including quorum) of Qualifications Scotland and that of any of its committees or sub-committees.
Subject to this paragraph and any regulations made under it, Qualifications Scotland may regulate its own procedure (including quorum) and that of any of its committees or sub-committees other than—

P3para.Text: the Accreditation Committee,
any sub-committee of the Accreditation Committee.

P2para.Text: Subject to this paragraph and any regulations made under it, the Accreditation Committee may regulate its own procedure (including quorum) and that of any of its sub-committees.
Qualifications Scotland may authorise—

P3para.Text: any of its members,
any committee or sub-committee established by it,
any member of its staff,
subject to the consent of the Scottish Ministers, any other person,

P2para.Text: to perform such of its functions (and to such extent) as it may determine.
But Qualifications Scotland may not authorise another person to perform any of the following functions—

P3para.Text: approving its corporate plan for submission to the Scottish Ministers under section 16,
approving its annual report prepared under section 17,
approving its accounts for submission to the Scottish Ministers under section 20,
the functions of the Accreditation Committee.

P2para.Text: The Accreditation Committee may authorise—

P3para.Text: any of its members,
any sub-committee established by it,
any member of staff of Qualifications Scotland,

P2para.Text: to perform such of its functions (and to such extent) as it may determine.
But the Accreditation Committee may not authorise another person to perform any of the following functions—

P3para.Text: approving the corporate plan prepared under section 24,
approving the annual report prepared under section 25.

P2para.Text: The giving of authority under this paragraph to perform a function does not—

P3para.Text: affect Qualifications Scotland’s or (as the case may be) the Accreditation Committee’s responsibility for the performance of the function, or
prevent Qualifications Scotland or (as the case may be) the Accreditation Committee from performing the function itself.

P2para.Text: In the exercise of Qualifications Scotland’s functions, the members appointed to satisfy paragraph 3(2)(c) must, in every case in which Qualifications Scotland considers it appropriate to do so, consult such persons with an interest as Qualifications Scotland considers appropriate.
For the purposes of sub-paragraph (1), persons with an interest are—

P3para.Text: persons who are members of staff of Qualifications Scotland,
representatives from recognised trade unions which represent the interests of the persons mentioned in paragraph (a),
other persons appearing to Qualifications Scotland to represent the interests of the persons mentioned in paragraph (a).

P2para.Text: In sub-paragraph (2)(b), “trade union” has the meaning given by section 1 of the Trade Union and Labour Relations (Consolidation) Act 1992 and “recognised”, in relation to a trade union, is to be construed in accordance with section 178(3) of that Act.

P1para.Text: The validity of anything done by Qualifications Scotland or its committees or sub-committees is not affected by—

P3para.Text: a vacancy in membership,
a defect in the appointment of a member or the chief executive,
a person’s membership ending by virtue of paragraph 5(1)(b).

TitleBlock.Title: The Office of His Majesty’s Chief Inspector of Education in Scotland

P1para.Text: The Chief Inspector is, as Chief Inspector, to be regarded as a juristic person distinct from the individual for the time being holding the office.

P2para.Text: In performing the Chief Inspector’s functions, the Chief Inspector is not subject to the direction or control of any member of the Scottish Government.
Sub-paragraph (1) is subject to any contrary provision in this or any other enactment.
The office of Chief Inspector is to be held by an individual appointed by His Majesty by Order in Council on the recommendation of the Scottish Ministers.
The Scottish Ministers may recommend the appointment of an individual as the Chief Inspector only where they consider that the individual has—

P3para.Text: suitable teaching experience, and
relevant experience of acting in a leadership role in an educational establishment.

P2para.Text: The Chief Inspector holds and vacates office at His Majesty’s pleasure.
The Scottish Ministers may determine the other terms and conditions on which the Chief Inspector is appointed.
The Chief Inspector may appoint staff.
Those staff are appointed on such terms and conditions as the Chief Inspector, with the approval of the Scottish Ministers, determines.
The Chief Inspector may authorise an Inspector to perform such of the Chief Inspector’s functions (and to such extent) as the Chief Inspector may determine.
Sub-paragraph (1) is without prejudice to the ability of the Deputy Chief Inspector to perform the Chief Inspector’s functions when deputising for the Chief Inspector under section 34.
The giving of authority under this paragraph to perform a function does not—

P3para.Text: affect the Chief Inspector’s responsibility for the performance of the function, or
prevent the Chief Inspector from performing the function.

P2para.Text: The Scottish Ministers may assign to an Inspector the function of deputising for the Chief Inspector during any period when both—

P3para.Text: there is no Chief Inspector, or the Chief Inspector is unable to act, and
there is no Deputy Chief Inspector, or the Deputy Chief Inspector is unable to act.

P2para.Text: An Inspector to whom such a function is assigned—

P3para.Text: is assigned the function for such period as the Scottish Ministers specify in the assignment,
may resign the assignment by informing the Scottish Ministers in writing to that effect,
is assigned it, and ceases to be assigned it, in accordance with such terms and conditions as the Scottish Ministers determine.

P1para.Text: The validity of anything done by the Chief Inspector is not affected by a defect in a person’s appointment as Chief Inspector.

TitleBlock.Title: Transfer of staff, property etc. to Qualifications Scotland

P1para.Text: In this schedule, “transfer date” means the date on which this paragraph comes into force.

P2para.Text: With effect from the transfer date, any person who, immediately before that date, was employed by the Scottish Qualifications Authority, is transferred into the employment of Qualifications Scotland.
The contract of employment of a person transferred by virtue of sub-paragraph (1)—

P3para.Text: is not terminated by the transfer, and
has effect from the transfer date as if originally made between the person and Qualifications Scotland.

P2para.Text: Without prejudice to sub-paragraph (2), where a person is transferred by virtue of sub-paragraph (1)—

P3para.Text: all the rights, powers, duties and liabilities of the Scottish Qualifications Authority under or in connection with the person’s contract of employment are transferred to Qualifications Scotland on the transfer date, and

anything done before that date by or in relation to the Scottish Qualifications Authority in respect of the person or the contract is to be treated from that date as having been done by or in relation to Qualifications Scotland.

P2para.Text: If, before the transfer date, the person informs the Scottish Qualifications Authority that the person does not wish to become an employee of Qualifications Scotland—

P3para.Text: sub-paragraphs (1) to (3) do not apply to the person, and
the person’s contract of employment is terminated on the day before the transfer date.

P2para.Text: A person is not to be treated for any purpose as being dismissed by reason of the operation of any provision of this paragraph in relation to the person.

Nothing in this paragraph affects any right of a person so transferred to terminate the person’s contract of employment if the terms and conditions of employment are changed substantially to the detriment of the person.
No such right arises by reason only that, by virtue of this paragraph, the identity of the person’s employer changes.
With effect from the transfer date, all property, rights, liabilities and obligations to which sub-paragraph (2) applies, are transferred to, and vest in, Qualifications Scotland.
Sub-paragraph (1) applies to—

P3para.Text: all property (including corporeal and incorporeal moveable property) which immediately before the transfer date was owned by the Scottish Qualifications Authority, and
all rights, liabilities and obligations which, immediately before the transfer date, subsisted in respect of the Scottish Qualifications Authority.

P2para.Text: Sub-paragraph (1) has effect in relation to any property or liabilities to which it applies despite any provision (of whatever nature) which would otherwise prevent, penalise or restrict the transfer of the property or liabilities.

P1group.Title: Duty to secure vesting of foreign property

P1para.Text: The Scottish Qualifications Authority and Qualifications Scotland must take all such steps as may be required to secure that the vesting in Qualifications Scotland of any foreign property, right, liability or obligation of the Scottish Qualifications Authority, is effective under the relevant foreign law.

P2para.Text: The person who is, immediately before the date on which this paragraph fully comes into force (the “member appointment date”), the chairing member of the Scottish Qualifications Authority is, on that date, taken to have been appointed as the chairing member of Qualifications Scotland under paragraph 2(1)(a) of schedule 1.

The Scottish Ministers may by regulations provide that a person who is, immediately before the member appointment date, a member (other than the chairing member) of the Scottish Qualifications Authority, is to be taken to have been appointed as a member of Qualifications Scotland under paragraph 2(1) of schedule 1.
Regulations under sub-paragraph (2) may provide that—

P3para.Text: a person mentioned in sub-paragraph (4) is to be treated for the purposes of schedule 1 as if the person were appointed as a member of Qualifications Scotland to satisfy paragraph 3(2)(b)(i) or (ii) of that schedule,

where, before the member appointment date, such a person has ceased to be a person mentioned in that paragraph, the person is to be treated for the purposes of schedule 1 as if the person had ceased to be a person mentioned in that paragraph after being appointed as a member of Qualifications Scotland.

P2para.Text: A person referred to in sub-paragraph (3) is a person who—

P3para.Text: is to be taken to have been appointed as a member of Qualifications Scotland by virtue of regulations made under sub-paragraph (2), and
was a person mentioned in paragraph 3(2)(b)(i) or (as the case may be) (ii) of schedule 1 when appointed as a member of the Scottish Qualifications Authority.

P2para.Text: A person who is a member of Qualifications Scotland by virtue of sub-paragraph (1) or (2) is referred to in this paragraph as an “initial member”.

Except as may be agreed between the Scottish Ministers and an initial member, the terms of the member’s appointment are the same as the terms on which the member was appointed as a member of the Scottish Qualifications Authority so far as consistent with this Act.

For the purposes of this paragraph, the “chairing member of the Scottish Qualifications Authority” is the chairman of the Scottish Qualifications Authority appointed under paragraph 8 of schedule 1 of the Education (Scotland) Act 1996.

Chapter.Title: Application of legislation relating to public bodies to Qualifications Scotland

P1group.Title: Ethical Standards in Public Life etc. (Scotland) Act 2000

P2para.Text: The Ethical Standards in Public Life etc. (Scotland) Act 2000 is modified as follows.
In schedule 3 (devolved public bodies)—

P3para.Text: at the appropriate place in alphabetical order, insert “Qualifications Scotland”,
the entry relating to the Scottish Qualifications Authority is repealed.

P2para.Text: The Scottish Public Services Ombudsman Act 2002 is modified as follows.
In Part 2 of schedule 2 (listed authorities: entries amendable by order in council)—

P3para.Text: after the entry relating to the Principal Reporter (paragraph 32AA), insert—

P1para.Text: Qualifications Scotland.

P3para.Text: the entry relating to the Scottish Qualifications Authority (paragraph 49) is repealed.

P2para.Text: The Freedom of Information (Scotland) Act 2002 is modified as follows.
In Part 7 of schedule 1 (Scottish public authorities: others)—

P3para.Text: after the entry relating to the Poverty and Inequality Commission (paragraph 75AC), insert—

P1para.Text: Qualifications Scotland.

P3para.Text: the entry relating to the Scottish Qualifications Authority (paragraph 96) is repealed.

P1group.Title: Public Appointments and Public Bodies etc. (Scotland) Act 2003

P2para.Text: The Public Appointments and Public Bodies etc. (Scotland) Act 2003 is modified as follows.
In schedule 2 (the specified authorities), under the heading “Executive bodies”—

P3para.Text: at the appropriate place in alphabetical order, insert “Qualifications Scotland”,
the entry relating to the Scottish Qualifications Authority is repealed.

P2para.Text: The Public Services Reform (Scotland) Act 2010 is modified as follows.
In schedule 5 (improvement of public functions: listed bodies), under the heading “Scottish public authorities with mixed functions or no reserved functions”—
